highlights: Support the development team with all things CI/CD, Infrastructure, and platform, including running production deployments, debugging platform code, configuring Datadog monitors and alerts

Prototyped a custom terraform provider (golang) to enable Infrastructure-as-Code for internally visible API objects. Replacing toilsome platform configuration steps with the standard terraform workflow
Replaced toilsome AMI creation and promotion process with an automated, self-service process using Jenkins, Vault, and Packer

Replaced static Jenkins build nodes with dynamic nodes using a packer-based AMI. This resulted in an improved security posture (nodes run latest OS by re-building base AMI), and less toil maintaining "pet" infrastructure

Maintain (replace, or delete where possible) various chef recipes, ansible playbooks, Jenkinsfiles, groovy libraries, terraform modules, python scripts, dockerfiles, powershell scripts, helm charts, and packer templates
Support customers during critical system outages by providing accurate, timely problem diagnoses and clear resolution steps
Help customers deploy CloudBees CI to various K8S environments (AWS EKS, GCP, Rancher, self-hosted) using Helm
Manage a backlog of customer support requests ranging from diagnosing complex technical issues to recommending CI/CD best practices
Re-create product issues and collaborate with engineering to deliver bug fixes
Create customer facing knowledge base articles and documentation fixes
Verification and scale testing of KVM and virtualization solutions on system Z for various linux distros
Find software bugs and determine root-cause, follow-through with development team to ensure bug resolution
As technical lead, facilitate stand-ups and retrospectives, collaborate on testcase design and prioritization, remove blockers
Drive adoption of modern infrastructure automation tools through education, workshops, and by supporting team members
Collaborate with IBM KVM development team to plan and prioritize for upcoming test cycle
Participated in the entire SDLC, from discovery to deployment and maintenance, of two OS-level components
Led adoption of a modern CI pipeline resulting in improved code quality and a streamlined developer experience
As iteration manager, facilitated daily stand-ups, user story sessions, design discussions, and retrospectives
